title: Stories of the Border Marches
author: Lang, John
snippet: Gibson did not wish to act hastily, but allhis private investigations pointed only to the one conclusion, and therewas no room for doubt that the ewe had been seen by shepherds on otherfarms making her way across the lofty hills that lie between Newby andWormiston, as the latter place was locally called.

title: Stories of the Border Marches
author: Lang, John
snippet: Gibson did not wish to act hastily, but allhis private investigations pointed only to the one conclusion, and therewas no room for doubt that the ewe had been seen by shepherds on otherfarms making her way across the lofty hills that lie between Newby andWormiston, as the latter place was locally called.

title: Letters from Thomas Percy, D.D. :
snippet: Sir Robert  Sibbald says, that Spence of Wormiston pleaded the privilege, and proved himself to be with the degrees of consanguinity, before the judge, and gave the compensation for the slaughter of Kininmount, p.

title: Journal of a lady of quality;
author: Schaw, Janet
snippet: J "Major Lindsay" was probably Major Martin Eccles Lindsay, son of Henry of Wormiston, though the identification is not certain.

title: Journal of a lady of quality;
author: Schaw, Janet
snippet: This Gentleman who is universally and justly admired, is brother to Lindsay of Wormiston in Fife.
